name: Mr Do!
overview: Similar in some ways to Namco's “Dig Dug,” the arcade “Mr. Do!" manufactured and launched in 1982 by the Universal company was also certainly popular. In such a way that it became popular, immediately afterwards, for a variety of consoles and home video game systems such as the Atari 2600, the 8-bit range of Atari computers, ColecoVision, Commodore 64 and MSX, among others. Mister Do, the main character of the game, is a circus clown and is constantly chased by red monsters called 'creeps'. The player loses a life, if Mr. Do is caught by one of them. The game ends when the last life of the three we have had from the beginning has been lost.
